fields.description: If you supply www suffix to bitbucket pages, you will be logged out. https access on www will also give out certificate error. These problems can be avoided with permanent www. redirect to plain bitbucket.org pages.

In the first/default wiki page, we need another "/" in the url (between the repo name and "wiki"), so that it ends with "repo/wiki/".

it currently reads:\\
{{{\\
Go ahead and try:

$ hg clone http://bitbucket.org/user/repowiki/\\
Wiki pages are normal files, with the .wiki extension. You can edit them locally, as well as creating new ones.\\
}}}

bitbucket rocks!

I tried doing "I forget my password" to get a new one and I get it but it does not work for doing https clone and also does not work as old password when changing password.

{{{\\
[hallon@hallon] /tmp $ hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/levsa/repo\\
Enter passphrase for key '/home/hallon/.ssh/id_dsa':\\
destination directory: repo\\
no changes found\\
updating to branch default\\
0 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
[hallon@hallon] /tmp $ cd repo\\

[hallon@hallon] repo $ hg add x\\
[hallon@hallon] repo $ hg commit -m"Foo"\\
[hallon@hallon] repo $ hg push\\
Enter passphrase for key '/home/hallon/.ssh/id_dsa':\\

[hallon@hallon] repo $

}}}

I am using ssh and openid. I want to try https but I can not even do a clone as my password is not accepted, but that is another bug I suppose.

The wiki is mostly useful to have some info to present to the users, something like a little webpage.

It is instead not very handy to discuss between developers.\\
An etherpad would be much much better.

The default wiki page for a new repo states the address:\\
$ hg clone http://bitbucket.org/phq/personal-proxywiki/\\
Which is wrong, the correct one is displayed above the page.

In short, there should be a "/" between the repo name and the word "wiki".

It'd be nice if you had something similar to GitHub's compare view, which allows you to see commits and diffs between two points in time.

These points can be commits, tags or HEAD.

Example: http://github.com/mojombo/jekyll/compare/master
fields.summary: Compare view; compare two arbitrary points in time (BB-836)

fields.description: Hi Jesper.

I'm not sure what timezone the bitbucket servers are in, but it would be great if I could customize the timezone I want a repository to show commits and wiki edits for, or maybe just in my personal profile choose my timezone for all repositories and wiki edits.

That way it will be easier to tell if something just happened or if it happened hours ago, and it will never appear as though it hasn't happened yet (timestamp from the "future").

Thanks!
fields.summary: Option to adjust dates to local time zone.

Blake.

fields.description:
When viewing the history of a wiki page in a private repository all the email addresses are obfuscated.  This is very annoying as the domain is the same for all of us, but the history view shows the full domain and only the first two letters of the user which isn't unique.

Since spambots can't see the private repositories there is no need to protect against them.
fields.summary: Email annoyingly obfuscated in private wiki history (BB-834)

fields.description:
Hi folks !

Just to mention that when we are commiting our change, it sometime take a VERY long period of time before the actual source tags on the site get updated.

It would be nice if the delay could be shorter, or if we could click a refresh button to manually update the site... or if you could configure some kind of post-commit hook.

Thanks :)

the section where the dead link appears is...

"Firmware 1.2.4 warning"

the section where the dead link appears is...

"Firmware 1.2.4 warning"

Thanks for your work

It would be nice if it were possible to have separate permissions for the wiki and for the source code.

Such as giving to a user r/w in the wiki and either ro or nothing for the source code, you get the idea...

Use case: giving to non-programmers people involved in a project the ability to view or edit the wiki or use the issue tracker, without having _any_ risk of them messing with the sources for some reason.

I don't know if it could be useful to have the opposite too (i.e. wiki ro and source r/w).

I'd found a number of bugs in a project binary I had just uploaded, and so I decided to delete and reupload a fixed version of the binary. However, my reuploaded version would not show up in the project's download list _unless it was saved with a different name than the file I had deleted._

The project's download page is here:\\
http://bitbucket.org/alunbestor/boxer/downloads

You'll note that the number in the downloads tab is 15, but there are only 11 files listed for download. The missing files are there on the server - I can download them directly by entering their expected URL - but they don't show up in the list. It looks to me like "deleted" files are being hidden, not deleted, and uploading a new version with the same name replaces the old file but doesn't unhide it in the process.

<<issue 1942>> may be related to this.
fields.summary: Deleted-and-reuploaded files not appearing in downloads list

fields.description: According to your footer you are only running Hg version 1.3.1 when there already is a 1.5.3 version out. Do you plan upgrading?

fields.description: It is not obvious how to unfollow a repository when it has been deleted. I follow(ed) a repository that is now deleted but it still remains in my followed list which is annoying. A unfollow option directly from the followed list in my home or an automatic unfollow when a repository is deleted would be nice.

Hello,

sphinx-build -b html source dest

give this sphinx error :

'ascii' can't encode character u'\xe9' in position ....

* 

In my rst file, I had :

.. automodule:: scenarii.essais.why_sphinx_error

:members:

:undoc-members:

:show-inheritance:

* 

Where "why_sphinx_error.py" is :

* 

{{{\\
#!python

#!/usr/bin/python

h1. -_- coding: ISO-8859-1 -_-
"""\\
at this place "é" give no sphinx error\\
"""

class ButThisYes(object):\\
"""

{code}
 but in this place, "é" give sphinx error :
 'ascii' can't encode character u'\xe9' in position ....
 
 why ?
"""

def __init__(self):
    """
     but in this place, "é" give sphinx error :
     'ascii' can't encode character u'\xe9' in position ....

     why ?
    """
{code}

}}}

----
Merci pour votre réponse.

fields.description:
When the header of a page (containing repo description, clone info and buttons) is collapsed to save screen height, we get one line with the names of the user and the repo on the left and buttons on the right. However, if the repo is a fork of another repo, the box with this info will cause the buttons to be on another line. I’d like to have only one line in collapsed mode.

Sorry if I haven’t found a good title for this ;)

Regards
fields.summary: Save space in collapsed header for a fork

fields.description:
When the header part of a page (description of the repo, buttons and clone info) is collapsed to save screen height, all buttons are moved to the right except for the follow button. I think it should be there too.

Regards
fields.summary: Display follow button in collapsed view (BB-833)

fields.description:
_PLEASE_ make the text as wide as the user's screen.

(Why pretend I have a 17" monitor, when I have 22"???)

_PLEASE_ don't just "chop off all the lines"... and then "add a horizontal scrollbar".

Doing so makes it VERY difficult to see the ends of any lines... if you have more than a full vertical screen of code.

Try to view the end of line BCLOUD-1... when the horizontal scroll-bar is 200 lines OFF the bottom of the screen.

Ugh.
fields.summary: Do we all still have 17" monitors????

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to have an rss feed for open issues.

If this already exists it might be nice to have it more obvious :-D.

It would be nice if it was possible to disable anonymous bug reports.

Even though a warning might inspire anonymous reporters to follow issues for a few days, developers might not have time to start working on the issues immediately. Later on, requesting more information to an incomplete issue turns out to be impossible.

the "patch series" tab is the only place on bitbucket to view patches in order, but there is no other useful information on this page.  it would help users to quickly review a patch queue if bitbucket added:

* a brief description of each patch (taken from the commit message in the patch itself)
* a link to the source for the patch

currently, in order to review a patch queue, i have to keep two browser windows open and shuttle back and forth from the "Patch Series" view to the "Source" view.
fields.summary: Patch Series: add patch description and link to source (BB-831)

fields.description:

I am logged in.

a b a to a p

for commits is not very informative... it would be way better to have the actual commit message in the rss feed

I'm assigning this to you Jesper because you're first on the list.

Thanks,

Paul

fields.summary: Linking to changesets doesn't work for non tip revisions. (BB-829)

fields.description:
Well, as many of u know, recently some new updates were made on the Abyssal realm. After the updates, it is said that mindflay was fixed and lifebloom dispell effect gives mana back to caster.\\
But, now one lifebloom stack gives final healin 2k down from 6k.\\
As u guys know, 2k was the final healing on TBC, so wtf? 3 stacks of lifebloom should not stack and influence the final healing. So, fix the final healing, make some calculation reading what lifebloom HoT should heal divided to the final healing and see the result :p.\\
I did it, and the it gave me like this: Hot * 20.66666667 = Final healing.

Here's the top of the mail I got:\\
{{{\\
From: issues-noreply@bitbucket.org\\
Subject: Issue 124 in pip: page-retrieval code slowdown?\\
Date: Wed, 19 May 2010 09:48:13 -0000\\
To: dave@boostpro.com\\
Message-ID: [20100519094813.17741.10749%40localhost.localdomain]\\
Reply-To: issues-noreply@reply.bitbucket.org

--- you can reply above this line ---

Issue 124: page-retrieval code slowdown?\\
http://bitbucket.org/ianb/pip/issue/124/page-retrieval-code-slowdown\\
}}}

So... can I reply or can't I?  The Reply-To address seems to conflict with the first line of the message, which says I can reply.

Youtube stores all Videos as MP4 and FLV.\\
I would like to have an option to specifiy "download as MP4"

Background: there are a lot media players appliances in the market which are not able to play FLV, but MP4 (for example the popular WD TV Live HD)

thanks for feedback
fields.summary: feature request: download clips as MP4 (not FLV)

fields.description: The ajax request on http://bitbucket.org/pchambon/python-rock-solid-tools/downloads/delete never returns, so deprecated downloads cant be removed from the project page.

Please add pivotaltracker broker.\\
Broker code can be found here: http://bitbucket.org/paul.okopny/pivotaltrackerbroker.\\
This broker allows tracking project's progress via pivotaltracker (http://www.pivotaltracker.com) - story-based project planning tool.

http://bitbucket.org/biosinteractive/biosingine has been 'creating' for quite some time now. I've tried deleting the project and re-making it several times with no effect.

Note: I've tried several more times and had no luck.

Commit messages like\\
{{{\\
fixed foo (closes BCLOUD-3)\\
}}}\\
do not trigger the issue service.

See http://bitbucket.org/olt/mapproxy/changeset/a1fb40fdeb01 for example. Might be the closing bracket.
fields.summary: Issues service does not handle all issue numbers.

fields.description:
This may be the same issue as <<issue 683>> - it's hard to tell - but I've been unable to push to Bitbucket.org using HTTPS for at least a month (the same password works for the normal web UI). Using SSH works as expected so this hasn't been a major issue for me but it doesn't appear to be <<issue 939>> as there isn't a proxy involved.

Mercurial Distributed SCM (version 1.5.1)\\
Mac OS X 10.6.3

See the attached screenshots for a Firefox nightly and IE7 screenshot.

I would suspect the tooltips are meant to originate from either the mouse cursor position or the element which is being hovered.
fields.summary: Tooltip does not originate from hovered element.

fields.description: As stated above I can't login when I use IE8 (I do, sometimes) because pressing enter when I have filled in the details does not log me in.
fields.summary: IE8 can't use enter in login form.

fields.description: I can select new file only. How to delete picture?
fields.summary: Have no chance to delete repo picture (BB-5467)

fields.description:
Security by isolating the unavoidalbe risk of web visits

See it? It is not really a bug, but many users will not take you seriously if you don't spell, well, perfectly.

[ unavoidable ] on page:

http://bitbucket.org/joxo009/safersurfin/wiki/Home\\
Kind regards!\\
moB
For instance, cannot retrieve http://bitbucket.org/aristede/zimmerman
fields.summary: Cannot access my repositories through the web

fields.description: http://bitbucket.org/zakhar/maxgame/wiki/Home
fields.summary: Internal Server Error when I try to open deleted repo

fields.description:
I've been trying to clone /basho/riak into /rtilder/riak for about 20-30 minutes now.  At my request, at least one other person I know has successfully cloned the same repo.  I am able to clone /basho/riak into /rtilder/riak-turd successfully.

Some weeks ago, I had cloned /basho/riak into /rtilder/riak and then deleted /rtilder/riak since it was just part of a test.  I only mention it now because I think it might be related.
fields.summary: Fork failure when trying to re-occupy deleted repository (BB-826)

fields.description:
Bonjour a tous,

Voila, j'allais a Hache-tripes nord et, la plupart des ogres (pas tous) sont affichés en *rouge* et nous attaques  mais, son considérés comme *une cible amicale*.

Un peu comme les ingénieurs bâtisseurs au joug. Ah et leurs niveau est affiché en jaune/orange.\\
Bug survenus depuis peu.

Merci d'avoir pris compte de mon post.\\
Cordialement, Lortath

//P.s//: Merci a Ezu pour être venu m'aider et qui m'as donné le conseil de posté ici :)

I pushed some changes to bitbucket and got an error message:

{{{\\
remote: pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/leogluzman/nadovmeste/\\
remote: searching for changes\\
remote: remote: adding changesets\\
remote: remote: adding manifests\\
remote: remote: adding file changes\\
remote: remote: added 2 changesets with 2 changes to 2 files\\
remote: remote: bb/acl: kmike is allowed. accepted payload.\\
remote: remote: quota: 5.6 MB in use, 1.0 GB available (0.55% used)\\
remote: remote: error: changegroup.csetlog hook raised an exception: 'NoneType' object has no attribute '_repo'\\
}}}

Though it seems that changes are pushed.

fields.summary: Display of Bullets of lists in wiki (BB-748)

This is the comment I'm referring to:

http://bitbucket.org/chris1610/satchmo/issue/1148/#comment-176298

From my account, there's some markup issues too, which screws up the layout and possibly other stuff, preventing me from editing the comment
fields.summary: comment with diff marked as spam

fields.description:
I have been getting the following error message all day for _all_ my repositories when trying tu push/pull/clone as usual:

**abort: error: Connection refused

Have not seen anyone tweet about this, so I think it might be a bug with my account?.

When attempting to push or pull receive the following:\\
abort: error: Connection refused.

Please advise.

Thanks,

Mike
fields.summary: Receiving connection refused when pushing or pulling

fields.description:
Bonjour, et merci d'avoir créer...hum ce Bidule _-_

Bon, certains mobs a Haches-tripes nord ne sont pas attaquables mais ils nous attaquent, et sont vus en ''rouge'' (comme des ennemis)

Ils sont comme les maître de construction dans le joug, rouge mais non attaquable.

Certains ogres sont attaquables, mais peu.\\
Veuillez en prendre compte.

Merci, Cordialement.\\
Lortath

P.s: Merci a Eze d'être venu pour voir le problème avec moi :)

When I push to http://bitbucket.org/dongsheng/g11n by HTTP,  I got error:

abort: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error

Then I push by ssh, but hang, after killed TortoisePlink, I got message:

interrupted!

remote: waiting for lock on repository dongsheng/g11n held by 'fe01:28643'
fields.summary: remote: waiting for lock on repository

fields.description:
I've tried to fork a repo. It left it for about 30 minutes, and it was still busy. The text said to go to admin, delete repo, and try again. So I did.

Now I'm stuck with a repo that doesn't exist (according to http://bitbucket.org/wanwizard/codeigniter), but I can't fork again (error: repo already exists), while the status message says "You are currently on the free plan, using 6.9 MB out of 1.0 GB total", which is about the size of the forked repo.

How can I permanently delete that repo so I can create the fork again?
fields.summary: Repo fork in a weird state

fields.description:
I just installed ver 20100511. Installation proceeded without incident. However, when I "print" a pdf file, it shows up momentarily in the shared spool folder and then disappears into the ether.

I'm using OS 10.6.3 on an Intel iMac.
Performing an HG push on our repository bitbucket.org/mcameron/warmhealth/ takes 1-3 minutes each time the command is performed.
fields.summary: ssh pushing takes 1-3 mins every time

fields.description:
Example: http://bitbucket.org/carljm/django-form-utils/src/tip/form_utils/templatetags/

The breadcrumbs for form_utils and templatetags is missing the / resulting in:\\
http://bitbucket.org/carljm/django-form-utils/srce77957b43306/form_utils/templatetags/

instead of:\\
http://bitbucket.org/carljm/django-form-utils/src/e77957b43306/form_utils/templatetags/

Seems to be when you view a folder.
fields.summary: The breadcrumbs path is sometimes missing a / after src.

fields.description:
Hi, Looks like you have a db connection issue. Connections are currently hanging on both web browser view of repo and hg push to a repo.

Hg push eventually returns:

remote: Traceback (most recent call last):\\
remote:   File "/usr/local/bin/conq", line 91, in <module>\\
remote:     if user_can_read(dest_user, dest_repo, user):\\
remote:   File "/usr/local/bin/conq", line 44, in user_can_read\\
remote:     repo = Repository.objects.get(owner__username=user, slug=repo)\\
remote:   File "/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/Django-1.1-py2.5.egg/django/db/models/manager.py", line 120, in get\\
remote:     return self.get_query_set().get(*args, **kwargs)\\
remote:   File "/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/Django-1.1-py2.5.egg/django/db/models/query.py", line 300, in get\\
remote:     num = len(clone)\\
remote:   File "/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/Django-1.1-py2.5.egg/django/db/models/query.py", line 81, in *len*\\
remote:     self._result_cache = list(self.iterator())\\
remote:   File "/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/Django-1.1-py2.5.egg/django/db/models/query.py", line 238, in iterator\\
remote:     for row in self.query.results_iter():\\
remote:   File "/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/Django-1.1-py2.5.egg/django/db/models/sql/query.py", line 287, in results_iter\\
remote:     for rows in self.execute_sql(MULTI):\\
remote:   File "/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/Django-1.1-py2.5.egg/django/db/models/sql/query.py", line 2368, in execute_sql\\
remote:     cursor = self.connection.cursor()\\
remote:   File "/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/Django-1.1-py2.5.egg/django/db/backends/*init*.py", line 81, in cursor\\
remote:     cursor = self._cursor()\\
remote:   File "/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/Django-1.1-py2.5.egg/django/db/backends/postgresql_psycopg2/base.py", line 98, in _cursor\\
remote:     self.connection = Database.connect(**conn_params)\\
remote: psycopg2.OperationalError: server closed the connection unexpectedly\\
remote: 	This probably means the server terminated abnormally\\
remote: 	before or while processing the request.\\
